result.execSummary:
The defendant Spencer R. Leu was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Forfeitures and costs are to be paid at the rate of $75 a month beginning September 1, 2022. The bond of $500.00 has been applied towards the forfeiture and costs.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Court re:  attorney fees
Petition and Order for Extension to Pay

8:51 AM Defendant Spencer R. Leu in court.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court for Spencer R. Leu.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record. Plea of no contest to Count 1 in 22CM6. Plea of no contest to the amended charge of Disorderly Conduct on count 3 of 22CM6. Court accepts the plea of no contest on count 3 and finds the defendant guilty. Court orders forfeiture of $263.50 plus $67 victim witness surcharge. Plea of no contest to amended count 5 of Possession of THC-party to a crime in 22CM32. Court accepts the plea of no contest and finds the defendant guilty. Court orders forfeiture of $263.50 plus $67 victim witness surcharge. Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court makes a finding of guilt in count 1 of 22CM6. Statement made by Attorney Fuhr. Statement made by Attorney Snyder. Court orders a deferred entry of judgment agreement for a period of 2 years with conditions of no new criminal charges, compliance with the bond requirements, AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations, domestic violence counseling, a letter of apology to K.C.H due within 30 days of sentencing to be preapproved by the DA's office. Court orders bond modification to eliminate the no contact with the victim K.C.H. Court dismisses but reads in count 2. Court dismisses but reads in counts1-4 in 22CM32.-JN
Status hearing on August 3, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

9:00 AM Defendant Spencer R. Leu in court.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court for Spencer R. Leu.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim notification has been complied.  Waives further reading of the complaint, charges and penalties. Plea of not guilty entered,  Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
